column2: Fortis Healthcare Ltd is looking for Assistant Manager - Hospital Operations to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey       Support Hospital Operations Manager    : Assist the Hospital Operations Manager in planning, organizing, and directing the overall operations of the hospital to ensure smooth functioning and optimal resource utilization.        Departmental Coordination    : Collaborate with department heads, including nursing, clinical services, facilities management, and support services, to coordinate activities, resolve operational issues, and promote interdisciplinary teamwork.        Quality Assurance and Compliance    : Ensure adherence to regulatory standards, accreditation requirements, and quality benchmarks in all aspects of hospital operations, including patient care, safety protocols, infection control, and documentation practices.        Performance Monitoring and Analysis    : Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), operational metrics, and patient satisfaction scores to identify trends, assess performance, and implement process improvements that enhance operational efficiency and service delivery.        Patient Flow Management    : Oversee patient flow processes, bed management, and patient admissions, transfers, and discharges to optimize capacity, minimize wait times, and enhance the patient experience.        Emergency Response and Crisis Management    : Assist in developing and implementing emergency response plans, disaster preparedness protocols, and crisis management procedures to ensure the safety and well-being of patients, staff, and visitors during critical situations.        Staff Development and Training    : Support the training and development initiatives for hospital staff, including orientation programs, continuing education, and skill enhancement workshops, to promote professional growth, competence, and teamwork.        Customer Service Excellence    : Foster a culture of patient-centered care, empathy, and compassion among staff members by promoting service excellence, addressing patient feedback, and resolving service-related issues in a timely and responsive manner.        Budgeting and Resource Allocation    : Assist in budget planning, expenditure tracking, and resource allocation processes to ensure fiscal responsibility, cost containment, and optimal utilization of financial resources across hospital departments.        Technology Integration and Process Improvement    : Identify opportunities for leveraging technology solutions, automation, and best practices to    streamline workflows, reduce administrative burdens, and enhance operational effectiveness in hospital operations.
column11: operations management, healthcare consulting, health care services, administration, healthcare management, nursing, nabh, hospital administration, patient care, healthcare, hospital operations, operations, hospital management, hospital marketing

column2: Reports To: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) or Board of Directors Job Summary: The Hospital Management Administrator is responsible for overseeing the daily operations and administration of the hospital. This includes managing staff, coordinating healthcare services, ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations, and improving the overall efficiency and quality of patient care. The role requires strong leadership skills and the ability to make strategic decisions to enhance the hospital's operational performance. Key Responsibilities: Operational      Management: Oversee the day-to-day       operations of the hospital, ensuring efficient and effective service       delivery. Develop and implement       policies and procedures to improve hospital operations. Coordinate with department       heads to ensure seamless integration of services and optimal patient       care. Staff Management: Recruit, train, and       supervise hospital staff, including medical, administrative, and support       personnel. Evaluate staff performance       and provide ongoing training and development opportunities. Foster a positive and       collaborative work environment. Financial Management: Develop and manage the       hospital's budget, ensuring financial sustainability. Monitor financial       performance and implement cost-control measures. Oversee billing, coding,       and reimbursement processes. Compliance and Quality Assurance: Ensure compliance with       healthcare regulations, standards, and accreditation requirements. Implement quality       assurance programs to improve patient care and safety. Conduct regular audits and       reviews to ensure adherence to policies and procedures. Strategic Planning and Development: Develop and execute       strategic plans to achieve the hospital's goals and objectives. Identify opportunities for       growth and expansion of services. Collaborate with the       executive team to set long-term goals and priorities. Patient Care Coordination: Ensure the delivery of       high-quality patient care services. Address patient complaints       and resolve issues promptly and effectively. Implement patient       satisfaction and feedback programs. Community Relations and Marketing: Build and maintain       relationships with community leaders, stakeholders, and healthcare       partners. Promote the hospital's       services and programs through marketing and public relations efforts. Represent the hospital at       community events and health fairs. Technology and Information Management: Oversee the implementation       and maintenance of hospital information systems. Ensure the security and       confidentiality of patient records. Utilize data analytics to improve hospital operations and patient       outcomes. Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business      Administration, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. Experience:       Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in hospital administration or      healthcare management. Skills: Strong leadership and       management skills. Excellent communication       and interpersonal abilities. Proficiency in financial       management and budgeting. Knowledge of healthcare       regulations and standards. Ability to develop and       implement strategic plans. Proficiency in healthcare information systems and technology. Physical Requirements: Ability      to work in a standard office environment. Ability to sit for extended periods and      use a computer. Occasional travel for meetings and conferences. Working Conditions: Work      in a hospital environment with potential exposure to infectious diseases. Occasional evening or weekend work to meet organizational needs

column2: Job Purpose The representative is responsible for collections, account follow up, billing and allowance posting for  the accounts assigned to them. Duties and Responsibilities ??Follow-up with payers to ensure timely resolution of all outstanding claims, via phone, emails,  fax or websites. ??Meets and maintains daily productivity/quality standards established in departmental policies. ??Uses the workflow system, client host system and other tools available to them to collect  payments and resolve accounts. ??Adheres to the policies and procedures established for the client/team. ??Knowledge of timely filing deadlines for each designated payer. ??Performs research regarding payer specific billing guidelines as needed. ??Ability to analyze, identify and resolve issues causing payer payment delays. ??Ability to analyze, identify and trend claims issues to proactively reduce denials. ??Communicates to management any issues and/or trends identified. ??Initiate appeals when necessary. ??Ability to identify and correct medical billing errors. ??Send appropriate appeals, accurate requesting information, supporting documentation, and  effective communication to complete recovery process. ??Understanding of under or over payments and credit balance processes. ??Assist with special A/R projects as needed. Analytical skills and the ability to communicate  results are required. ??Act cooperatively and courteously with patients, visitors, co-workers, management and clients. ??Use, protect and disclose patients protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with  Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards. ??Work independently from assigned work queues. ??Maintain confidentiality at all times. ??Maintain a professional attitude. ??Other duties as assigned by the management team  Qualifications ??Completed at least High School education ??With minimum 1 year of Healthcare Account Receivable/Collections in a BPO setting or  environment (claims payments processing, claims status and tracking, Medical Billing, AR  Follow ups, Denials and Appeals-outbound healthcare providers) ??Experienced on medical billing/ AR Collections. ??Background in calling insurance (Payer) to verify claim status and payment dispute. ??Must be amenable to work night shifts.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Brief Summary of Job responsibilities in 2-3 lines : Managing, supervising and controlling Central Sterile Supply Departments work flow to the level of customers satisfaction. Maintain the departmental running/ capital cost well within the budget. To practice best protocols in the field of medical equipments/ instrument sterilization to control Hospital Associated Infections. General Job responsibilities : 1. Responsible for the daily administrative activities. 2. To adhere to the departmental code of conduct 3. To document and maintain the S.O.P of the department and ensure strict adherence to the same. 4. To maintain records of all important documents that includes Quality Control test carried out by the department. 5. Overall responsible for smooth functioning of the department  6. Upgrade oneself with the latest technology in the field. 7. To control the inventory of the department.  8. Collaborate on an atmosphere of fun and encouragement; identify ways in which employees can better serve the organization. 9. Communicate expectations to employees, and follow up by monitoring job performance. 10. Mentor, coach and correct employees as and when necessary. 11. Liaise with clients and suppliers, that helps the smooth flow of the department. 12. Set goals for the department, implement systems, and develop departmental budgets. 13. Coordinate the purchase of supplies, equipment, and attend the tender committee meetings. 14. Collaborate with staff as and when necessary on special projects.  15. Perform any other work related duty assigned by the superior.   Specific Job responsibilities: 1. Planning and developing the department processes in synchronization with the organization?? mission and goal. 2. To be a member of Infection control committee and be guided by the recommendations of the committee. 3. To prepare annual capital and revenue budget of the department and ensure strict adherence to it. 4. Technical evaluation of equipment along with Bio- Medical / Engineering team at the time of purchase of any new equipment.  5. To Develop policies and protocol for sterilization of goods received in Hospitals and implement the same.  6. To check Quality control of process are done in accordance with the SOP. 7. Conduct Instrument selection committee meetings for purchase of instruments. 8. Assist Infection Control team to organize the activities of HIC as a custodian of NABH HIC chapter 9. Daily Check on correspondence of officers / Supervisors received on difficulties in processes and take appropriate action. 10. Validate quality control test of steam sterilizers along with biological results of steam/EO/ Plasma sterilization to verify the sterilization process is appropriate. 11. As a part of Champion?? training team organizer assist in organizing champion?? training. 12. Approve Leaves of I & above staff in Spine. 13. To be a member of Infection control committee and be guided by the recommendations of the committee  14. Maintain strong relationships with vendors and keep price data in order to get the best pricing on supplies and services. 15. To attend the unresolved issues of the departments and take corrective action 16. To maintain inter and intra-departmental smooth work flow. 17. To induction the department to the visitors. 18. To help identify newer vendors for better quality and cost containment. 19. To plan, coordinate and implement projects as identified by the senior leadership. 20. Conduct Departmental meetings 21. To keep Chief operating officer updated on the various issues of the departments Preferred candidate profile   B.Sc + relevant qualification in CSSD

column2: As the Hospital Manager at JKKN Dental College and Hospital, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the efficient and effective operation of our dental hospital      Your leadership and management skills will contribute directly to our vision and mission, as you oversee the hospitals day-to-day activities, strategic planning, resource allocation, and staff management                  Key Responsibilities:            Strategic Planning:    Develop and implement strategic plans aligned with the institutions vision and mission to enhance the quality of patient care, education, and research.        Operational Management:    Oversee the daily operations of the hospital, including patient flow, scheduling, staff management, and resource allocation.        Quality Assurance:    Maintain and improve the quality of patient care by implementing and monitoring healthcare standards, policies, and procedures.        Patient Experience:    Ensure a positive patient experience by fostering a patient-centered environment, addressing patient concerns, and maintaining high levels of patient satisfaction.        Team Leadership:    Provide effective leadership to the hospital staff, including dental professionals, administrative personnel, and support staff, to promote teamwork, collaboration, and professional growth.        Budget Management:    Manage financial resources, prepare budgets, monitor expenses, and optimize revenue generation to achieve financial sustainability.        Regulatory Compliance:    Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations, licensing requirements, and accreditation standards.        Technology Integration:    Stay abreast of advancements in dental technology and ensure their effective integration into hospital operations and patient care.        Community Engagement:    Develop and maintain positive relationships with the community, referring physicians, and external stakeholders to promote the hospitals services.        Performance Evaluation:    Conduct performance evaluations, provide feedback, and implement training and development programs for staff.        Emergency Preparedness:    Develop and implement protocols for handling emergencies and crisis situations within the hospital.              Qualifications:            Education:    A Masters degree in Healthcare Administration, Hospital Management, Business Administration, or a related field. A dental or medical background is a plus.        Experience:    2 years experience in hospital administration or healthcare management, preferably in a dental or medical setting.        Leadership Skills:    Proven leadership and management experience, with the ability to inspire and lead a diverse team.        Strategic Thinking:    Strong strategic planning and problem-solving skills to drive the hospitals growth and success.        Communication:    Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with staff, patients, stakeholders, and the community.        Financial Acumen:    Proficiency in budget management, financial analysis, and revenue optimization.        Regulatory Knowledge:    Knowledge of healthcare regulations, accreditation standards, and compliance requirements.        Interpersonal Skills:    Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with staff, patients, and external partners.        Technology Proficiency:    Familiarity with healthcare management software, electronic health records (EHR), and other relevant technologies.        Adaptability:    Ability to adapt to changing healthcare trends, patient needs, and technological advancements.        Ethical Conduct:    Demonstrated commitment to ethical standards, patient confidentiality, and quality care.
